<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span></h2>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-3">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Taipei" title="Taipei">Taipei</a> is the official seat of <a href="/wiki/Government_of_the_Republic_of_China" title="Government of the Republic of China">government of the Republic of China</a> although the <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_the_Republic_of_China" title="Constitution of the Republic of China">Constitution of the Republic of China</a> does not specify the <i>de jure</i> capital.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2"><a href="#cite_note-2">[1]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-7"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-7">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Taiwanese_Mandarin" title="Taiwanese Mandarin">Mandarin</a> as the standard <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Variety_of_Chinese" title="Variety of Chinese">variety of Chinese</a><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-推動雙語國家政策問題研析_5-0"><a href="#cite_note-推動雙語國家政策問題研析-5">[3]</a></sup><br/><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Vernacular_Chinese" title="Vernacular Chinese">Vernacular Chinese</a> (used in most occasions) <br/><a href="/wiki/Classical_Chinese" title="Classical Chinese">Classical Chinese</a> (used in formal or ceremonial occasions, religious or cultural rites, official documents, legal and court rulings and judiciary documents)<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6"><a href="#cite_note-6">[4]</a></sup> </span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-nat-lang-12"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-nat-lang_12-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-nat-lang_12-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-nat-lang_12-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-nat-lang_12-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Not designated but meets legal definition</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-16"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-16">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">A national language in Taiwan is legally defined as "a natural language used by an original people group of Taiwan and the <a href="/wiki/Taiwan_Sign_Language" title="Taiwan Sign Language">Taiwan Sign Language</a>".<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-natLangAct_15-0"><a href="#cite_note-natLangAct-15">[11]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-17"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-17">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Mixed indigenous-Han ancestry is included in the figure for Han Taiwanese.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-22"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-22">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The <a href="/wiki/Republic_of_Formosa" title="Republic of Formosa">Republic of Formosa</a> was declared on 23 May 1895 and was conquered by Japan on 21 October 1895.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-23"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-23">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The Republic of China was officially established on 1 January 1912.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-24"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-24">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Interpretations on whether this entails a complete transfer of the territory's sovereignty to the Republic of China vary. Japan renounced its claims to Taiwan and the Pescadores in the <a href="/wiki/Treaty_of_San_Francisco" title="Treaty of San Francisco">Treaty of San Francisco</a> in 1952; see <a href="/wiki/Retrocession_Day" title="Retrocession Day">Retrocession Day</a>, <a href="/wiki/Theory_of_the_Undetermined_Status_of_Taiwan" title="Theory of the Undetermined Status of Taiwan">Theory of the Undetermined Status of Taiwan</a> and <a href="/wiki/Political_status_of_Taiwan" title="Political status of Taiwan">political status of Taiwan</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-25"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-25">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The <a href="/wiki/China_and_the_United_Nations" title="China and the United Nations">Republic of China</a> was the founding member of the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">United Nations</a> and joined on 24 October 1945. Recognition was shifted to the People's Republic of China by the <a href="/wiki/Soviet_Union" title="Soviet Union">Soviet Union</a> (2 October 1949), the United Kingdom (6 January 1950), France (27 January 1964), and the United States (1 January 1979); see the <a href="/wiki/Timeline_of_diplomatic_relations_of_the_Republic_of_China" title="Timeline of diplomatic relations of the Republic of China">Timeline of diplomatic relations of the Republic of China</a>, <a href="/wiki/Foreign_relations_of_Taiwan" title="Foreign relations of Taiwan">Foreign relations of Taiwan</a> and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/One-China_policy" title="One-China policy">One-China policy</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-ROC_territory-34"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-ROC_territory_34-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-ROC_territory_34-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">There are three contemporary geographic definitions of "Taiwan" (see <a href="/wiki/List_of_islands_of_Taiwan" title="List of islands of Taiwan">List of islands of Taiwan</a> and <a href="/wiki/Regions_of_Taiwan" title="Regions of Taiwan">Regions of Taiwan</a>), which may refer to: <div><ol><li>Common name of the state officially named the Republic of China, this contains all 168 islands administered by the ROC, collectively known as the <a href="/wiki/Free_area_of_the_Republic_of_China" title="Free area of the Republic of China">Taiwan Area</a>;</li><li>Taiwan proper region (本島地區), the geographical unit encompass the island of Taiwan and its offshore islands including the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Penghu_Islands" title="Penghu Islands">Penghu Islands</a>, excluding the outlying island groups of <a href="/wiki/Kinmen" title="Kinmen">Kinmen</a>, <a href="/wiki/Matsu_Islands" title="Matsu Islands">Matsu</a>, <a href="/wiki/Wuqiu,_Kinmen" title="Wuqiu, Kinmen">Wuqiu</a>, lie just off the coast of southeastern China, and the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/South_China_Sea_islands" title="South China Sea islands">South China Sea islands</a>;</li><li>The <a href="/wiki/Geography_of_Taiwan" title="Geography of Taiwan">island of Taiwan</a>, this indicates only the main island within the geographical unit and the state.</li></ol></div></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-35"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-35">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">See <a href="#Etymology">etymology</a> below.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Taiwan_Islands-47"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Taiwan_Islands_47-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Taiwan_Islands_47-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">According to official data from <a href="/wiki/Executive_Yuan" title="Executive Yuan">Executive Yuan</a> and local governments of Taiwan, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Taiwan_Area" title="Taiwan Area">Taiwan Area</a> consists of total 168 naturally occurring islands. 
<div><ol><li>Taiwan (Formosa) and its offshore islands (22)<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-TWN-gov_37-0"><a href="#cite_note-TWN-gov-37">[24]</a></sup></li><li><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Penghu_Islands" title="Penghu Islands">Penghu Islands</a> (90)<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Penghu1_38-0"><a href="#cite_note-Penghu1-38">[25]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Penghu2_39-0"><a href="#cite_note-Penghu2-39">[26]</a></sup></li><li><a href="/wiki/Kinmen" title="Kinmen">Kinmen</a>, including <a href="/wiki/Wuqiu,_Kinmen" title="Wuqiu, Kinmen">Wuqiu</a> (17)<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Kinmen1_40-0"><a href="#cite_note-Kinmen1-40">[27]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Kinmen2_41-0"><a href="#cite_note-Kinmen2-41">[28]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Kinmen3_42-0"><a href="#cite_note-Kinmen3-42">[29]</a></sup></li><li><a href="/wiki/Matsu_Islands" title="Matsu Islands">Matsu Islands</a> (36)<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Matsu1_43-0"><a href="#cite_note-Matsu1-43">[30]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Matsu2_44-0"><a href="#cite_note-Matsu2-44">[31]</a></sup></li><li><a href="/wiki/Pratas_Island" title="Pratas Island">Pratas Island</a> (1) <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-lungtsunni_45-0"><a href="#cite_note-lungtsunni-45">[32]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-USStateDept_46-0"><a href="#cite_note-USStateDept-46">[33]</a></sup></li><li><a href="/wiki/Spratly_Islands" title="Spratly Islands">Spratly Islands</a> (2, <a href="/wiki/Taiping_Island" title="Taiping Island">Taiping</a> and <a href="/wiki/Zhongzhou_Reef" title="Zhongzhou Reef">Zhongzhou</a>)</li></ol></div></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-HDI-1-57"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-HDI-1_57-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The UN <a href="/wiki/China_and_the_United_Nations" title="China and the United Nations">does not consider</a> the Republic of China as a <a href="/wiki/Sovereign_state" title="Sovereign state">sovereign state</a>. The HDI report does not include Taiwan as part of the People's Republic of China when calculating mainland China's figures.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HDI-2_54-0"><a href="#cite_note-HDI-2-54">[40]</a></sup> Taiwan's government calculated its HDI to be 0.907 based on UNDP's 2010 methodology, which would rank it 21st, between Austria and Luxembourg in the UN list dated 14 September 2018.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HDI-3_55-0"><a href="#cite_note-HDI-3-55">[41]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HDI-4_56-0"><a href="#cite_note-HDI-4-56">[42]</a></sup> </span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-78"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-78">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Although this is the present meaning of <i><span title="Chinese-language text"><i lang="zh-Latn-pinyin">guó</i></span></i>, in <a href="/wiki/Old_Chinese" title="Old Chinese">Old Chinese</a> (when its pronunciation was something like <span class="nowrap">/*qʷˤək/</span>)<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-bs_76-0"><a href="#cite_note-bs-76">[61]</a></sup> it meant the walled city of the Chinese and the areas they could control from them.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-wilx_77-0"><a href="#cite_note-wilx-77">[62]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-80"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-80">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Its use is attested from the sixth-century <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Classic_of_History" title="Classic of History">Classic of History</a>, which states "<a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Tian_(god)" title="Tian (god)">Huangtian</a> bestowed the lands and the peoples of the central state to the ancestors" (<span title="Chinese-language text"><span lang="zh">皇天既付中國民越厥疆土于先王</span></span>).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-79"><a href="#cite_note-79">[63]</a></sup></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-lower-roman">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-328"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-328">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Also known as the Taiwan area or Tai–Min area (<a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant">臺閩地區</span>; <small><a href="/wiki/Literal_translation" title="Literal translation">lit.</a></small> 'Taiwan–Fujian area')</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-329"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-329">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The mainland area consists of Mainland China, <a href="/wiki/Tibet" title="Tibet">Tibet</a> and (previously) <a href="/wiki/Outer_Mongolia" title="Outer Mongolia">Outer Mongolia</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-331"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-331">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Special municipalities, cities, and county-administered cities are all called <i>shi</i> (<a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant">市</span>; <small><a href="/wiki/Literal_translation" title="Literal translation">lit.</a></small> 'city')</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-332"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-332">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Nominal; provincial governments have been abolished</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-333"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-333">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Constitutionally having the same structure as the free area, these are currently under the <a href="/wiki/Chinese_Communist_Party" title="Chinese Communist Party">Chinese Communist Party</a> control with a different structure</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-334"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-334">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Sometimes called cities (<a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant">市</span>) or provincial cities (<a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant">省轄市</span>) to distinguish them from special municipalities and county-administered cities</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-336"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-336">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">There are two types of townships: rural townships or <i>xīang</i> (<a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant">鄉</span>) and urban townships or <i>zhèn</i> (<a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant">鎮</span>)</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-338"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-338">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Villages in rural townships are known as <i>tsūn</i> (<a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant">村</span>), those in other jurisdictions are known as <i>lǐ</i> (<a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant">里</span>)</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Words_in_native_languages">Words in native languages</span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-upper-roman">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-word1-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-word1_1-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-word1_1-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><div><ul><li><a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">Traditional Chinese script</a>: <span title="Chinese-language text"><span lang="zh-Hant-TW">中華民國</span></span></li><li><a href="/wiki/Taiwanese_Mandarin" title="Taiwanese Mandarin">Mandarin</a> <a href="/wiki/Pinyin" title="Pinyin">Pinyin</a>: <span title="Mandarin Chinese-language text"><i lang="cmn-Latn-TW">Zhōnghuá Mínguó</i></span></li><li><a href="/wiki/Taiwanese_Hokkien" title="Taiwanese Hokkien">Hokkien</a>: <span title="Min Nan Chinese-language text"><i lang="nan-Latn-TW">Tiong-hûa Bîn-kok</i></span></li><li><a href="/wiki/Sixian_dialect" title="Sixian dialect">Sixian</a> Hakka: <span title="Hakka-language text"><i lang="hak-Latn-TW">Chûng-fà Mìn-koet</i></span></li></ul></div></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-word2-33"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-word2_33-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><div><ul><li><a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">Traditional Chinese script</a>: <span title="Chinese-language text"><span lang="zh-Hant-TW">臺灣 or 台灣</span></span></li><li><a href="/wiki/Taiwanese_Mandarin" title="Taiwanese Mandarin">Mandarin</a> <a href="/wiki/Pinyin" title="Pinyin">Pinyin</a>: <span title="Mandarin Chinese-language text"><i lang="cmn-Latn-TW">Táiwān</i></span></li><li><a href="/wiki/Taiwanese_Hokkien" title="Taiwanese Hokkien">Hokkien</a>: <span title="Min Nan Chinese-language text"><i lang="nan-Latn-TW">Tâi-uân</i></span></li><li><a href="/wiki/Sixian_dialect" title="Sixian dialect">Sixian</a> Hakka: <span title="Hakka-language text"><i lang="hak-Latn-TW">Tǒi-vǎn</i></span></li><li><a href="/wiki/Amis_language" title="Amis language">Amis</a>: <span title="Amis-language text"><i lang="ami-Latn-TW">Taywan</i></span></li><li><a href="/wiki/Paiwan_language" title="Paiwan language">Paiwan</a>: <span title="Paiwan-language text"><i lang="pwn-Latn-TW">Taiwan</i></span></li></ul></div></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

<li id="cite_note-10"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-10">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFLiao2008">Liao, Silvie (2008). </li>
<li id="cite_note-11"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-11">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://www.ey.gov.tw/Page/4EC2394BE4EE9DD0/51cc88a4-2066-44da-964d-18e10468f578" rel="nofollow">"行政院第3251次院會決議"</a>. <i>www.ey.gov.tw</i> (in Chinese)<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">25 May</span> 2021</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=www.ey.gov.tw&amp;rft.atitle=%E8%A1%8C%E6%94%BF%E9%99%A2%E7%AC%AC3251%E6%AC%A1%E9%99%A2%E6%9C%83%E6%B1%BA%E8%AD%B0&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ey.gov.tw%2FPage%2F4EC2394BE4EE9DD0%2F51cc88a4-2066-44da-964d-18e10468f578&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-36"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-36">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Multiple sources:
<ul><li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFMichael_Kort2005"><a href="/wiki/Michael_Kort" title="Michael Kort">Michael Kort</a> (2005). <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/handbookofeastas0000kort/page/7" rel="nofollow"><i>The Handbook Of East Asia</i></a>. Lerner Publishing Group. p. <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/handbookofeastas0000kort/page/7" rel="nofollow">7</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0761326724" title="Special:BookSources/978-0761326724"><bdi>978-0761326724</bdi></a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">26 June</span> 2022</span>. <q>South Korea is another emerging economic powerhouse, as is the Republic of China (ROC), a small country that occupies the island of Taiwan in the shadow of its enormous and hostile mainland neighbor, the PRC.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Handbook+Of+East+Asia&amp;rft.pages=7&amp;rft.pub=Lerner+Publishing+Group&amp;rft.date=2005&amp;rft.isbn=978-0761326724&amp;rft.au=Michael+Kort&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fhandbookofeastas0000kort%2Fpage%2F7&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFFell2018">Fell, Dafydd (2018). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=i8hHDwAAQBAJ" rel="nofollow"><i>Government and Politics in Taiwan</i></a>. London: Routledge. p. 305. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1317285069" title="Special:BookSources/978-1317285069"><bdi>978-1317285069</bdi></a>. <q>Moreover, its status as a vibrant democratic state has earned it huge international sympathy and a generally positive image.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Government+and+Politics+in+Taiwan&amp;rft.place=London&amp;rft.pages=305&amp;rft.pub=Routledge&amp;rft.date=2018&amp;rft.isbn=978-1317285069&amp;rft.aulast=Fell&amp;rft.aufirst=Dafydd&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Di8hHDwAAQBAJ&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation magazine cs1" id="CITEREFCampbell2020">Campbell, Matthew (7 January 2020). <a class="external text" href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2020-01-07/china-s-next-crisis-brews-in-taiwan-s-upcoming-election" rel="nofollow">"China's Next Crisis Brews in Taiwan's Upcoming Election"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Bloomberg_Businessweek" title="Bloomberg Businessweek">Bloomberg Businessweek</a></i>. No. 4642. pp. 34–39. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISSN_(identifier)" title="ISSN (identifier)">ISSN</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/issn/0007-7135" rel="nofollow">0007-7135</a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">24 September</span> 2020</span>. <q>Much has changed in Taiwan since Chiang's day, but this liminal quality has never really gone away. By almost any functional standard, it's a sovereign country</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Bloomberg+Businessweek&amp;rft.atitle=China%27s+Next+Crisis+Brews+in+Taiwan%27s+Upcoming+Election&amp;rft.issue=4642&amp;rft.pages=34-39&amp;rft.date=2020-01-07&amp;rft.issn=0007-7135&amp;rft.aulast=Campbell&amp;rft.aufirst=Matthew&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bloomberg.com%2Fnews%2Ffeatures%2F2020-01-07%2Fchina-s-next-crisis-brews-in-taiwan-s-upcoming-election&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFCarolan2000">Carolan, Christopher (May 2000). <a class="external text" href="https://www.nyulawreview.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/NYULawReview-75-2-Carolan.pdf" rel="nofollow">"The "Republic of Taiwan": Legal-Historical Justification for a Taiwanese Declaration of Independence"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>New York University Law Review</i>. <b>75</b> (2): 429–468<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">17 March</span> 2022</span>. <q>These six criteria demonstrate that under international law Taiwan merits recognition as an independent state and as such is already a de facto state.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=New+York+University+Law+Review&amp;rft.atitle=The+%22Republic+of+Taiwan%22%3A+Legal-Historical+Justification+for+a+Taiwanese+Declaration+of+Independence&amp;rft.volume=75&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=429-468&amp;rft.date=2000-05&amp;rft.aulast=Carolan&amp;rft.aufirst=Christopher&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nyulawreview.org%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2018%2F08%2FNYULawReview-75-2-Carolan.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFDonald_S._Zagoria2003"><a href="/wiki/Donald_S._Zagoria" title="Donald S. Zagoria">Donald S. Zagoria</a> (30 October 2003). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=J6lzCgAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA68" rel="nofollow"><i>Breaking the China-Taiwan Impasse</i></a>. ABC-CLIO. pp. 68–. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-313-05755-7" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-313-05755-7"><bdi>978-0-313-05755-7</bdi></a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/OCLC_(identifier)" title="OCLC (identifier)">OCLC</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/oclc/1058389524" rel="nofollow">1058389524</a><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">20 March</span> 2022</span>. <q>Taiwan possesses all of the elements of a sovereign state: a legitimate government, population, and a well-defined territory. The fact is that the People's Republic of China (PRC), while claiming sovereignty over Taiwan, has never ruled Taiwan since the PRC's establishment in 1949. Thus, Taiwan is in fact a sovereign country from our perspective.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Breaking+the+China-Taiwan+Impasse&amp;rft.pages=68-&amp;rft.pub=ABC-CLIO&amp;rft.date=2003-10-30&amp;rft_id=info%3Aoclcnum%2F1058389524&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-313-05755-7&amp;rft.au=Donald+S.+Zagoria&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DJ6lzCgAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA68&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></li></ul>
</span></li>
<li id="cite_note-TWN-gov-37"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-TWN-gov_37-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://www.ey.gov.tw/state/4447F4A951A1EC45/094b1d53-de8d-4393-bde6-ab092969cce4" rel="nofollow">"國情簡介-土地"</a> [Country profile-Territories] (in Chinese (Taiwan)). <a href="/wiki/Executive_Yuan" title="Executive Yuan">Executive Yuan</a>. 2022. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220304005302/https://www.ey.gov.tw/state/4447F4A951A1EC45/094b1d53-de8d-4393-bde6-ab092969cce4" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 4 March 2022. <q>臺灣本島及其21個附屬島嶼面積共3萬5886.8623平方公里。</q> [The main island of Taiwan and its 21 associated islands have a total area of 35,886.8623 square kilometers.]</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=%E5%9C%8B%E6%83%85%E7%B0%A1%E4%BB%8B-%E5%9C%9F%E5%9C%B0&amp;rft.pub=Executive+Yuan&amp;rft.date=2022&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ey.gov.tw%2Fstate%2F4447F4A951A1EC45%2F094b1d53-de8d-4393-bde6-ab092969cce4&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Penghu1-38"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Penghu1_38-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.penghu.gov.tw/en/home.jsp?id=13" rel="nofollow">"Measure of the area"</a>. <a href="/wiki/Penghu_County_Government" title="Penghu County Government">Penghu County Government</a>. 2022. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20211228213800/https://www.penghu.gov.tw/en/home.jsp?id=13" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 28 December 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-Penghu2-39"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Penghu2_39-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="http://phcsp.tmc.ksu.edu.tw/application/record/island" rel="nofollow">"澎湖縣各行政區域島嶼簡介"</a> (in Chinese (Taiwan)). <a href="/wiki/Kun_Shan_University" title="Kun Shan University">Kun Shan University</a>. 2022. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20200701020851/http://phcsp.tmc.ksu.edu.tw/application/record/island" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 1 July 2020. <q>澎湖群島原為64個島嶼組成，經2005年澎湖縣政府重新進行澎湖群島島嶼數量清查，係由90座大小島嶼所組成。</q> [The Penghu Archipelago was conventionally considered to comprise 64 islands. In 2005, the Penghu County Government re-scrutinized the total number of islands in the archipelago, which consists of 90 islands of varying sizes.]</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=%E6%BE%8E%E6%B9%96%E7%B8%A3%E5%90%84%E8%A1%8C%E6%94%BF%E5%8D%80%E5%9F%9F%E5%B3%B6%E5%B6%BC%E7%B0%A1%E4%BB%8B&amp;rft.pub=Kun+Shan+University&amp;rft.date=2022&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fphcsp.tmc.ksu.edu.tw%2Fapplication%2Frecord%2Fisland&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Kinmen1-40"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Kinmen1_40-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://ws.ndc.gov.tw/Download.ashx?u=LzAwMS9hZG1pbmlzdHJhdG9yLzEwL1JlbEZpbGUvNTU2Ni81MzQzLzAwMTU0ODlfNC5wZGY%3D&amp;n=Mi7ph5HploDnuKPnrKzlm5vmnJ8oMTA0LTEwN%2BW5tCnpm6Lls7bntpzlkIjlu7roqK3lr6bmlr3mlrnmoYgo5qC45a6a5pysKS5wZGY%3D&amp;icon=..pdf" rel="nofollow">"自然環境"</a> [Natural Environment] <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>金門縣第四期（104–107年）離島綜合建設實施方案</i> (in Chinese (Taiwan)). <a href="/wiki/National_Development_Council_(Taiwan)" title="National Development Council (Taiwan)">National Development Council</a>, <a href="/wiki/Executive_Yuan" title="Executive Yuan">Executive Yuan</a>: 44. 23 December 2014<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">9 March</span> 2022</span>. <q>金門縣總面積151平方公里，除大金門本島外，尚包括小金門、大膽、二膽、東碇、北碇等17個島嶼。西距廈門外港約10海浬，東距臺灣約150海浬，為一典型大陸型島嶼。</q> [The total area of Kinmen County is 151 square kilometers. In addition to the main island of Kinmen, the county also includes <a href="/wiki/Lieyu" title="Lieyu">Xiaokinmen</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dadan_Island" title="Dadan Island">Dadan</a>, <a href="/wiki/Erdan_Island" title="Erdan Island">Erdan</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dongding_Island" title="Dongding Island">Dongding</a> and <a href="/wiki/Beiding_Island" title="Beiding Island">Beiding</a> for a total of 17 islands. It is about 10 nautical miles away from the Port of <a href="/wiki/Xiamen" title="Xiamen">Xiamen</a> to the west and 150 nautical miles away from Taiwan to the east. It is a typical continental island.]</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=%E9%87%91%E9%96%80%E7%B8%A3%E7%AC%AC%E5%9B%9B%E6%9C%9F%EF%BC%88104%E2%80%93107%E5%B9%B4%EF%BC%89%E9%9B%A2%E5%B3%B6%E7%B6%9C%E5%90%88%E5%BB%BA%E8%A8%AD%E5%AF%A6%E6%96%BD%E6%96%B9%E6%A1%88&amp;rft.atitle=%E8%87%AA%E7%84%B6%E7%92%B0%E5%A2%83&amp;rft.pages=44&amp;rft.date=2014-12-23&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fws.ndc.gov.tw%2FDownload.ashx%3Fu%3DLzAwMS9hZG1pbmlzdHJhdG9yLzEwL1JlbEZpbGUvNTU2Ni81MzQzLzAwMTU0ODlfNC5wZGY%253D%26n%3DMi7ph5HploDnuKPnrKzlm5vmnJ8oMTA0LTEwN%252BW5tCnpm6Lls7bntpzlkIjlu7roqK3lr6bmlr3mlrnmoYgo5qC45a6a5pysKS5wZGY%253D%26icon%3D..pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Kinmen2-41"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Kinmen2_41-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.kinmen.gov.tw/en/cp.aspx?n=22D15C7FFDA4350D#Section_2" rel="nofollow">"About Kinmen"</a>. <a href="/wiki/Kinmen_County_Government" title="Kinmen County Government">Kinmen County Government</a>. 8 December 2017. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220302025937/https://www.kinmen.gov.tw/en/cp.aspx?n=22D15C7FFDA4350D" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 2 March 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-Matsu1-43"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Matsu1_43-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFGuy_Plopsky2017">Guy Plopsky (22 February 2017). <a class="external text" href="https://thediplomat.com/2017/02/taiwans-cold-war-fortresses/" rel="nofollow">"Taiwan's Cold War Fortresses"</a>. <a href="/wiki/The_Diplomat" title="The Diplomat">The Diplomat</a>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20210416223933/https://thediplomat.com/2017/02/taiwans-cold-war-fortresses/" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 16 April 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-Matsu2-44"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Matsu2_44-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="http://board.matsu.idv.tw/board_view.php?board=138&amp;pid=69202&amp;link=69202&amp;start=42" rel="nofollow">"連江縣志 地理志"</a> (in Chinese (Taiwan)). 馬祖資訊網. 12 May 2011. <q>馬祖列島所涵括的36座島嶼分屬四鄉，各鄉除了包括有聚落發展的較大島嶼外，還轄有數座無人島礁。</q> [Matsu islands encompass 36 Islands which are divided into four townships. In addition to the larger islands with inhabitants, each township also has numerous uninhabited islands and reefs]</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=%E9%80%A3%E6%B1%9F%E7%B8%A3%E5%BF%97+%E5%9C%B0%E7%90%86%E5%BF%97&amp;rft.pub=%E9%A6%AC%E7%A5%96%E8%B3%87%E8%A8%8A%E7%B6%B2&amp;rft.date=2011-05-12&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fboard.matsu.idv.tw%2Fboard_view.php%3Fboard%3D138%26pid%3D69202%26link%3D69202%26start%3D42&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-lungtsunni-45"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-lungtsunni_45-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1 cs1-prop-script cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREFLung_Tsun-Ni_龍村倪Category:Articles_containing_Chinese-language_text1998">Lung Tsun-Ni <span title="Chinese-language text"><span lang="zh-TW">龍村倪</span></span> (1998). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090130022327/http://vm.nthu.edu.tw/np/vc/theme/pratas/" rel="nofollow"><bdi lang="zh">東沙群島-東沙島紀事集錦</bdi></a> (in Chinese (Taiwan)). <a class="extiw" href="https://zh.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%87%BA%E7%81%A3%E7%B6%9C%E5%90%88%E7%A0%94%E7%A9%B6%E9%99%A2" title="zh:臺灣綜合研究院">臺灣綜合研究院</a>. p. 13. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/957-98189-0-8" title="Special:BookSources/957-98189-0-8"><bdi>957-98189-0-8</bdi></a>. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://vm.nthu.edu.tw/np/vc/theme/pratas/" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 30 January 2009. <q>東沙島為東沙群島唯一島嶼</q> [Pratas Island is the only island in the Pratas Islands]</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=%E6%9D%B1%E6%B2%99%E7%BE%A4%E5%B3%B6-%E6%9D%B1%E6%B2%99%E5%B3%B6%E7%B4%80%E4%BA%8B%E9%9B%86%E9%8C%A6&amp;rft.pages=13&amp;rft.pub=%E8%87%BA%E7%81%A3%E7%B6%9C%E5%90%88%E7%A0%94%E7%A9%B6%E9%99%A2&amp;rft.date=1998&amp;rft.isbn=957-98189-0-8&amp;rft.au=Lung+Tsun-Ni+%3Cspan+title%3D%22Chinese-language+text%22%3E%3Cspan+lang%3D%22zh-TW%22%3E%E9%BE%8D%E6%9D%91%E5%80%AA%3C%2Fspan%3E%3C%2Fspan%3ECategory%3AArticles+containing+Chinese-language+text&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fvm.nthu.edu.tw%2Fnp%2Fvc%2Ftheme%2Fpratas%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-USStateDept-46"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-USStateDept_46-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://2009-2017.state.gov/documents/organization/57674.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Limits in the Seas – No. 127 Taiwan's Maritime Claims"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">9 March</span> 2022</span>. <q>The Pratas Reef lies 230 miles to the southwest of the southern tip of Taiwan. </li>
<li id="cite_note-62"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-62">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFFell2006">Fell, Dafydd (2006). <i>Party Politics in Taiwan</i>. Routledge. p. 85. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-134-24021-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-134-24021-0"><bdi>978-1-134-24021-0</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Party+Politics+in+Taiwan&amp;rft.pages=85&amp;rft.pub=Routledge&amp;rft.date=2006&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-134-24021-0&amp;rft.aulast=Fell&amp;rft.aufirst=Dafydd&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-63"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-63">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFAchenWang2017">Achen, Christopher H.; Wang, T. Y. (2017). "The Taiwan Voter: An Introduction".  In Achen, Christopher H.; Wang, T. Y. (eds.). <i>The Taiwan Voter</i>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-yb:history-64"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-yb:history_64-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120514004941/http://www.gio.gov.tw/taiwan-website/5-gp/yearbook/docs/ch03.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Chapter 3: History"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>The Republic of China Yearbook 2011</i>. Government Information Office, Republic of China (Taiwan). 2011. p. 46. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.gio.gov.tw/taiwan-website/5-gp/yearbook/docs/ch03.pdf" rel="nofollow">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 14 May 2012.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Chapter+3%3A+History&amp;rft.btitle=The+Republic+of+China+Yearbook+2011&amp;rft.pages=46&amp;rft.pub=Government+Information+Office%2C+Republic+of+China+%28Taiwan%29&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.gio.gov.tw%2Ftaiwan-website%2F5-gp%2Fyearbook%2Fdocs%2Fch03.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-65"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-65">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20180414002106/http://www.npm.gov.tw/exhbition/formosa/english/02.htm" rel="nofollow">"Ilha Formosa: the Emergence of Taiwan on the World Scene in the 17th Century"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/National_Palace_Museum" title="National Palace Museum">National Palace Museum</a></i>. Archived from <a class="external text" href="https://www.npm.gov.tw/exhbition/formosa/english/02.htm" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 14 April 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">12 April</span> 2018</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=National+Palace+Museum&amp;rft.atitle=Ilha+Formosa%3A+the+Emergence+of+Taiwan+on+the+World+Scene+in+the+17th+Century&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.npm.gov.tw%2Fexhbition%2Fformosa%2Fenglish%2F02.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEDavidson190310-66"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEDavidson190310_66-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFDavidson1903">Davidson (1903)</a>, p. 10: "A Dutch navigating officer named <a href="/wiki/Jan_Huyghen_van_Linschoten" title="Jan Huyghen van Linschoten">Linschotten [<i>sic</i>]</a>, employed by the Portuguese, so recorded the island in his charts, and eventually the name of Formosa, so euphonious and yet appropriate, replaced all others in European literature."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-67"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-67">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">see for example:
<ul><li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFCampbell1915"><a href="/wiki/William_Campbell_(missionary)" title="William Campbell (missionary)">Campbell, William</a> (1915). <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/stream/sketchesfromtaiw00camprich#page/278/mode/2up" rel="nofollow"><i>Sketches from Formosa</i></a>. London: Marshall Brothers. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/OL_(identifier)" title="OL (identifier)">OL</a> <a class="external text" href="//openlibrary.org/books/OL7051071M" rel="nofollow">7051071M</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Sketches+from+Formosa&amp;rft.place=London&amp;rft.pub=Marshall+Brothers&amp;rft.date=1915&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fopenlibrary.org%2Fbooks%2FOL7051071M%23id-name%3DOL&amp;rft.aulast=Campbell&amp;rft.aufirst=William&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fstream%2Fsketchesfromtaiw00camprich%23page%2F278%2Fmode%2F2up&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></li>
<li><a href="#CITEREFCampbell1903">Campbell (1903)</a></li>
<li><a href="#CITEREFDavidson1903">Davidson (1903)</a></li></ul>
</span></li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEValentijn190352-68"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEValentijn190352_68-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFValentijn1903">Valentijn (1903)</a>, p. 52.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Mair-69"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Mair_69-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFMair2003"><a href="/wiki/Victor_H._Mair" title="Victor H. Mair">Mair, Victor H.</a> (2003). <a class="external text" href="http://pinyin.info/readings/mair/taiwanese.html" rel="nofollow">"How to Forget Your Mother Tongue and Remember Your National Language"</a>. <i>Pīnyīn.info</i>. <q>The true derivation of the name "Taiwan" is actually from the ethnonym of a tribe in the southwest part of the island in the area around Ping'an. As early as 1636, a Dutch missionary referred to this group as Taiouwang. From the name of the tribe, the Portuguese called the area around Ping'an as Tayowan, Taiyowan, Tyovon, Teijoan, Toyouan, and so forth. Indeed, already in his ship's log of 1622, the Dutchman Cornelis Reijersen referred to the area as Teijoan and Taiyowan.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=P%C4%ABny%C4%ABn.info&amp;rft.atitle=How+to+Forget+Your+Mother+Tongue+and+Remember+Your+National+Language&amp;rft.date=2003&amp;rft.aulast=Mair&amp;rft.aufirst=Victor+H.&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fpinyin.info%2Freadings%2Fmair%2Ftaiwanese.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-蔡玉仙等編-70"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-蔡玉仙等編_70-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1 cs1-prop-script cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREF蔡玉仙2007">蔡玉仙;  et al., eds. (2007).  <bdi lang="zh">府城文史</bdi> (in Chinese). <a href="/wiki/Tainan_City_Government" title="Tainan City Government">Tainan City Government</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-986-00-9434-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-986-00-9434-3"><bdi>978-986-00-9434-3</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=%E5%BA%9C%E5%9F%8E%E6%96%87%E5%8F%B2&amp;rft.pub=Tainan+City+Government&amp;rft.date=2007&amp;rft.isbn=978-986-00-9434-3&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-石守謙主編-71"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-石守謙主編_71-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1 cs1-prop-script cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREFShih_Shou-chien2003"><a href="/wiki/Shih_Shou-chien" title="Shih Shou-chien">Shih Shou-chien</a>, ed. Taipei: National Palace Museum. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-957-562-441-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-957-562-441-5"><bdi>978-957-562-441-5</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=%E7%A6%8F%E7%88%BE%E6%91%A9%E6%B2%99+%3A+%E5%8D%81%E4%B8%83%E4%B8%96%E7%B4%80%E7%9A%84%E8%87%BA%E7%81%A3%E3%80%81%E8%8D%B7%E8%98%AD%E8%88%87%E6%9D%B1%E4%BA%9E&amp;rft.place=Taipei&amp;rft.pub=National+Palace+Museum&amp;rft.date=2003&amp;rft.isbn=978-957-562-441-5&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-72"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-72">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1 cs1-prop-script cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREFKato2007">Kato, Mitsutaka (2007) [1940].  <bdi lang="zh">昨日府城 明星台南: 發現日治下的老臺南</bdi> (in Chinese). <li id="cite_note-Oosterhoff-73"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Oosterhoff_73-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Oosterhoff_73-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Oosterhoff_73-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFOosterhoff1985">Oosterhoff, J.L. <li id="cite_note-81"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-81">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFGarver1997">Garver, John W. <li id="cite_note-82"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-82">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://english.president.gov.tw/" rel="nofollow">"Office of President of the Republic of China (Taiwan)"</a>. <i>Office of President of the Republic of China (Taiwan)</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">15 July</span> 2015</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Office+of+President+of+the+Republic+of+China+%28Taiwan%29&amp;rft.atitle=Office+of+President+of+the+Republic+of+China+%28Taiwan%29&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fenglish.president.gov.tw%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-83"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-83">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.taiwan.gov.tw/about.php" rel="nofollow">"About Taiwan"</a>. <i>Taiwan.gov.tw</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-澎湖縣誌-98"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-澎湖縣誌_98-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="https://penghu.info/OBD601A5C7404754B4A6" rel="nofollow">「明萬曆年以後，澎湖第二次有移住民，以福建泉州府屬同安縣金門人遷來最早; 其後接踵而至者，亦以同安縣人為最多。彼等捷足先至者，得以優先選擇良好地區定居之，澎湖本島即多被同安人所先占; 尤其素稱土地沃之湖西鄉，完全成為同安人之區域。</a> 李紹章《澎湖縣誌》，《續修澎湖縣志（卷三）｜人民志》</span>

</li>
<li id="cite_note-101"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-101">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFCampbell1903"><a href="/wiki/William_Campbell_(missionary)" title="William Campbell (missionary)">Campbell, William</a> (1903). <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/formosaunderdut01campgoog" rel="nofollow"><i>Formosa Under the Dutch: Described from Contemporary Records, with Explanatory Notes and a Bibliography of the Island</i></a>. Kegan Paul, Trench, Trubner. pp. <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/formosaunderdut01campgoog/page/n185" rel="nofollow">6</a>–7. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9789576380839" title="Special:BookSources/9789576380839"><bdi>9789576380839</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Formosa+Under+the+Dutch%3A+Described+from+Contemporary+Records%2C+with+Explanatory+Notes+and+a+Bibliography+of+the+Island&amp;rft.pages=6-7&amp;rft.pub=Kegan+Paul%2C+Trench%2C+Trubner&amp;rft.date=1903&amp;rft.isbn=9789576380839&amp;rft.aulast=Campbell&amp;rft.aufirst=William&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fformosaunderdut01campgoog&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-104"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-104">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://en.tshs.ntpc.gov.tw/xmdoc/cont?xsmsid=0G292396897604829770" rel="nofollow">"Fort San Domingo"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Tamsui_Historical_Museum" title="Tamsui Historical Museum">Tamsui Historical Museum</a></i>. 3 July 2018<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">30 October</span> 2020</span>. <q>Fort San Domingo, located at the hilltop overlooking Tamsui River estuary, was established by the Spanish in 1628.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Tamsui+Historical+Museum&amp;rft.atitle=Fort+San+Domingo&amp;rft.date=2018-07-03&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fen.tshs.ntpc.gov.tw%2Fxmdoc%2Fcont%3Fxsmsid%3D0G292396897604829770&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEWills200691-105"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEWills200691_105-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEWills200691_105-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFWills2006">Wills (2006)</a>, p. 91.</span>

<li id="cite_note-LuWangNMHTW-106"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-LuWangNMHTW_106-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-script" id="CITEREFYan_Xing">Yan Xing. <a class="external text" href="https://tainanstudy.nmth.gov.tw/article/detail/9/read?" rel="nofollow"><bdi lang="zh">臺南與鄭成功</bdi></a> [Tainan and Zheng Chenggong (Koxinga)]. <i>Tainan Literature and History Research Database</i>. National Museum of Taiwan History<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">12 February</span> 2021</span>.  <bdi lang="zh">這時成功意志堅决，便單獨倡導拒滿復明運動，以金，厦兩島爲根據地地，不斷地向閩，浙東南一進攻，奉永明王永曆正朔<span class="nowrap"> </span>... 于永曆十一年（清順治十四年公元一六五七年）受永水明王封為延平王</bdi> [Then Chenggong (Koxinga) resolutely and independently advocated for the movement to resist the Manchus and restore Ming, with bases in Kinmen and Xiamen continuously attacked southeastern Min (Fujian) and Zhejiang, pledged to serve the Youngli emperor of Ming<span class="nowrap"> </span>... in 1657 was conferred the title King of Yanping by the Yong Ming emperor]</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Tainan+Literature+and+History+Research+Database&amp;rft.atitle=%E8%87%BA%E5%8D%97%E8%88%87%E9%84%AD%E6%88%90%E5%8A%9F&amp;rft.au=Yan+Xing&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Ftainanstudy.nmth.gov.tw%2Farticle%2Fdetail%2F9%2Fread%3F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-TWG2020-107"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-TWG2020_107-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-TWG2020_107-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://multilingual.mofa.gov.tw/web/web_UTF-8/MOFA/glance2020-2021/2020-2021%20Taiwan%20at%20a%20Glance%20(English).pdf" rel="nofollow"><i>2020–2021 Taiwan at a Glance</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <li id="cite_note-115"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-115">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSkoggard1996">Skoggard, Ian A. <li id="cite_note-116"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-116">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-script cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20220413234816/https://www.taiwanus.net/history/3/12.htm" rel="nofollow"><bdi lang="zh">三年小反五年大亂</bdi></a>. <i>台灣海外網</i> (in Chinese (Taiwan)). Archived from the original on 13 April 2022.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=%E5%8F%B0%E7%81%A3%E6%B5%B7%E5%A4%96%E7%B6%B2&amp;rft.atitle=%E4%B8%89%E5%B9%B4%E5%B0%8F%E5%8F%8D%E4%BA%94%E5%B9%B4%E5%A4%A7%E4%BA%82&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.taiwanus.net%2Fhistory%2F3%2F12.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span><span class="cs1-maint citation-comment"><code class="cs1-code">{{<a href="/wiki/Template:Cite_web" title="Template:Cite web">cite web</a>}}</code>:  CS1 maint: unfit URL (<a href="/wiki/Category:CS1_maint:_unfit_URL" title="Category:CS1 maint: unfit URL">link</a>)</span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-RebellionTWCulture-117"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-RebellionTWCulture_117-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-script"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20210310194052/http://nrch.culture.tw/twpedia.aspx?id=3553" rel="nofollow"><bdi lang="zh">民變</bdi></a> [Civil Strife]. <i>Encyclopedia of Taiwan (台灣大百科)</i>. Taiwan Ministry of Culture. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://nrch.culture.tw/twpedia.aspx?id=3553" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 10 March 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">28 February</span> 2021</span>.  <bdi lang="zh">臺灣有「三年一小反，五年一大反」之謠。但是根據研究，這句俗諺所形容民變迭起的現象，以道光朝（1820-1850）的三十多年間為主</bdi> [The rumor of "every three years a small uprising, five years a large rebellion" circulated around Taiwan. According to research, the repeated commotions described by this idiom occurred primarily during the 30-year period between 1820 and 1850.]</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Encyclopedia+of+Taiwan+%28%E5%8F%B0%E7%81%A3%E5%A4%A7%E7%99%BE%E7%A7%91%29&amp;rft.atitle=%E6%B0%91%E8%AE%8A&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnrch.culture.tw%2Ftwpedia.aspx%3Fid%3D3553&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEBallantine195216-118"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBallantine195216_118-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFBallantine1952">Ballantine (1952)</a>, p. 16.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEDavidson1903247,_620-119"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEDavidson1903247,_620_119-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFDavidson1903">Davidson (1903)</a>, pp. 247, 620.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-ShimonosekiROC-120"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-ShimonosekiROC_120-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-jul-greg-uncertainty cs1-prop-script"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20210417212021/http://libdb1.npm.gov.tw/ttscgi/capimg2.exe?20:268540019:910000115001-0-0.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Treaty of Peace between China and Japan (Treaty of Shimonoseki)"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>Ch'ing Dynasty Treaties and Agreements Preserved by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of China (Taiwan)</i>. National Palace Museum. 17 April 1895. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://libdb1.npm.gov.tw/ttscgi/capimg2.exe?20:268540019:910000115001-0-0.pdf" rel="nofollow">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 17 April 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">10 February</span> 2021</span>.  <bdi lang="zh">中國將管理下開地方之權並將該地方所有堡壘軍器工廠及一切屬公物件永遠讓於日本<span class="nowrap"> </span>... 台湾全岛及所有附属各岛屿<span class="nowrap"> </span>... 澎湖列岛</bdi> [China shall yield to Japan in perpetuity the rights to administer the following regions as well as all fortresses, munition factories, and public properties thereof<span class="nowrap"> </span>... the entire island of Taiwan and all appertaining islands<span class="nowrap"> </span>... Penghu archipelago]</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Ch%27ing+Dynasty+Treaties+and+Agreements+Preserved+by+the+Ministry+of+Foreign+Affairs+of+the+Republic+of+China+%28Taiwan%29&amp;rft.atitle=Treaty+of+Peace+between+China+and+Japan+%28Treaty+of+Shimonoseki%29&amp;rft.date=1895-04-17&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Flibdb1.npm.gov.tw%2Fttscgi%2Fcapimg2.exe%3F20%3A268540019%3A910000115001-0-0.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-121"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-121">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1 cs1-prop-script cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREFShiba1995"><a href="/wiki/Ry%C5%8Dtar%C5%8D_Shiba" title="Ryōtarō Shiba">Shiba, Ryōtarō</a> (1995). <i>Taiwan kikō : kaidō o yuku yonjū</i> <bdi lang="ja">台湾紀行: 街道をゆく〈40〉</bdi> (in Japanese). <li id="cite_note-pdo201011030c-138"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-pdo201011030c_138-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1 cs1-prop-script"><a class="external text" href="https://archive.today/20130102050033/http://tw.news.chinayes.com/Content/20101103/kccs09xiiw6ps_3.shtml" rel="nofollow"><bdi lang="zh">再發"參拜靖國神社"論 李登輝媚日情結大起底 3 November 2010</bdi></a>. <i><a href="/wiki/People%27s_Daily" title="People's Daily">People's Daily</a></i>. 3 November 2010. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://tw.news.chinayes.com/Content/20101103/kccs09xiiw6ps_3.shtml" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 2 January 2013<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-140"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-140">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFMorris2015">Morris, Andrew D. <li id="cite_note-cuhk-141"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-cuhk_141-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=z-fAxn_9f8wC&amp;pg=PA116" rel="nofollow"><i>China: Five Thousand Years of History and Civilization</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-142"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-142">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFRoy2003">Roy, Denny (2003). <span class="cs1-lock-registration" title="Free registration required"><a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/taiwan00denn" rel="nofollow"><i>Taiwan: A Political History</i></a></span>. Ithaca, New York: Cornell University Press. pp. <a class="external text" href="https://archive.org/details/taiwan00denn/page/55" rel="nofollow">55</a>, 56. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8014-8805-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8014-8805-4"><bdi>978-0-8014-8805-4</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Taiwan%3A+A+Political+History&amp;rft.place=Ithaca%2C+New+York&amp;rft.pages=55%2C+56&amp;rft.pub=Cornell+University+Press&amp;rft.date=2003&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-8014-8805-4&amp;rft.aulast=Roy&amp;rft.aufirst=Denny&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Ftaiwan00denn&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id='cite_note-FOOTNOTEBallantine195257:_"Chinese_forces_were_prepared_to_move_with_American_aid_by_an_amphibious_lift_into_Formosa&lt;span_class="nowrap"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;..._In_September_1945_the_administration_of_Formosa_was_taken_over_from_the_Japanese_by_Chinese_forces_assisted_by_numerically_small_United_States_teams"-143'><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href='#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBallantine195257:_"Chinese_forces_were_prepared_to_move_with_American_aid_by_an_amphibious_lift_into_Formosa&lt;span_class="nowrap"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;..._In_September_1945_the_administration_of_Formosa_was_taken_over_from_the_Japanese_by_Chinese_forces_assisted_by_numerically_small_United_States_teams"_143-0'>^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFBallantine1952">Ballantine (1952)</a>, p. 57: "Chinese forces were prepared to move with American aid by an amphibious lift into Formosa<span class="nowrap"> </span>... In September 1945 the administration of Formosa was taken over from the Japanese by Chinese forces assisted by numerically small United States teams".</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-144"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-144">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.twdefense.info/trust3/legitauth.html#Footnote-7" rel="nofollow">"The Exercise of Legitimate Authority"</a>. Taiwan Autonomy Foundation. 2021<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">8 January</span> 2022</span>. <q>The rules of the post-Napoleonic world consider that military occupation is only a temporary situation. The legal acquisition of territory and any long-term continuing exercise of legitimate authority over the territory is only accomplished through specific arrangements made in the final peace settlement.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+Exercise+of+Legitimate+Authority&amp;rft.pub=Taiwan+Autonomy+Foundation&amp;rft.date=2021&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.twdefense.info%2Ftrust3%2Flegitauth.html%23Footnote-7&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-145"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-145">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://hansard.millbanksystems.com/commons/1955/may/04/far-east-formosa-and-the-pescadores#S5CV0540P0_19550504_HOC_582" rel="nofollow">"Far East (Formosa and the Pescadores)"</a>. <i>Hansard</i>. <b>540</b> (cc1870–4). 4 May 1955<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">1 September</span> 2010</span>. <q>The sovereignty was Japanese until 1952. The Japanese Treaty came into force, and at that time Formosa was being administered by the Chinese Nationalists, to whom it was entrusted in 1945, as a military occupation.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Hansard&amp;rft.atitle=Far+East+%28Formosa+and+the+Pescadores%29&amp;rft.volume=540&amp;rft.issue=cc1870%E2%80%934&amp;rft.date=1955-05-04&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fhansard.millbanksystems.com%2Fcommons%2F1955%2Fmay%2F04%2Ffar-east-formosa-and-the-pescadores%23S5CV0540P0_19550504_HOC_582&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-146"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-146">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFCharneyPrescott2000">Charney, Jonathan I.; Prescott, J. R. V. (2000). "Resolving Cross-Strait Relations Between China and Taiwan". <i>American Journal of International Law</i>. <b>94</b> (3): 453–477. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.2307%2F2555319" rel="nofollow">10.2307/2555319</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/JSTOR_(identifier)" title="JSTOR (identifier)">JSTOR</a> <a class="external text" href="//www.jstor.org/stable/2555319" rel="nofollow">2555319</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/S2CID_(identifier)" title="S2CID (identifier)">S2CID</a> <a class="external text" href="https://api.semanticscholar.org/CorpusID:144402230" rel="nofollow">144402230</a>. <q>After occupying Taiwan in 1945 as a result of Japan's surrender, the Nationalists were defeated on the mainland in 1949, abandoning it to retreat to Taiwan.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=American+Journal+of+International+Law&amp;rft.atitle=Resolving+Cross-Strait+Relations+Between+China+and+Taiwan&amp;rft.volume=94&amp;rft.issue=3&amp;rft.pages=453-477&amp;rft.date=2000&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.semanticscholar.org%2FCorpusID%3A144402230%23id-name%3DS2CID&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.jstor.org%2Fstable%2F2555319%23id-name%3DJSTOR&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.2307%2F2555319&amp;rft.aulast=Charney&amp;rft.aufirst=Jonathan+I.&amp;rft.au=Prescott%2C+J.+R.+V.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Cairo1943-147"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Cairo1943_147-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.ndl.go.jp/constitution/e/shiryo/01/002_46shoshi.html" rel="nofollow">"Cairo Communiqué, December 1, 1943"</a>. <i>Birth of the Constitution of Japan</i>. Nationa Diet Library<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">29 November</span> 2021</span>. <q>It is their purpose that Japan shall be stripped of all the islands in the Pacific which she has seized or occupied since the beginning of the first World War in 1914, and that all the territories Japan has stolen from the Chinese, such as Manchuria, Formosa, and The Pescadores, shall be restored to the Republic of China.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Birth+of+the+Constitution+of+Japan&amp;rft.atitle=Cairo+Communiqu%C3%A9%2C+December+1%2C+1943&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ndl.go.jp%2Fconstitution%2Fe%2Fshiryo%2F01%2F002_46shoshi.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id='cite_note-FOOTNOTEBallantine1952162:_"United_States_Government_replied_on_this_point_as_follows:&lt;span_class="nowrap"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;..._Cairo_Declaration_provided_that_Manchuria,_Formosa,_and_the_Pescadores,_shall_be_restored_to_the_Republic_of_China"-148'><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href='#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBallantine1952162:_"United_States_Government_replied_on_this_point_as_follows:&lt;span_class="nowrap"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;..._Cairo_Declaration_provided_that_Manchuria,_Formosa,_and_the_Pescadores,_shall_be_restored_to_the_Republic_of_China"_148-0'>^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFBallantine1952">Ballantine (1952)</a>, p. 162: "United States Government replied on this point as follows:<span class="nowrap"> </span>... Cairo Declaration provided that Manchuria, Formosa, and the Pescadores, shall be restored to the Republic of China".</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Potsdam1945-149"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Potsdam1945_149-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.atomicheritage.org/key-documents/potsdam-declaration" rel="nofollow">"Potsdam Declaration"</a>. <i>The Atomic Heritage Foundation</i>. The Atomic Heritage Foundation and the National Museum of Nuclear Science &amp; History<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">29 November</span> 2021</span>. <q>The terms of the Cairo Declaration shall be carried out and Japanese sovereignty shall be limited to the islands of Honshu, Hokkaido, Kyushu, Shikoku and such minor islands as we determine.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Atomic+Heritage+Foundation&amp;rft.atitle=Potsdam+Declaration&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.atomicheritage.org%2Fkey-documents%2Fpotsdam-declaration&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-JapanSurrender-150"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-JapanSurrender_150-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.archivesfoundation.org/documents/japanese-instrument-surrender-1945/" rel="nofollow">"Japanese Instrument of Surrender"</a>. <i>The National Archives Foundation</i>. The National Archives<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">29 November</span> 2021</span>. <q>We hereby undertake for the Emperor, the Japanese Government and their successors to carry out the provisions of the Potsdam Declaration in good faith</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=The+National+Archives+Foundation&amp;rft.atitle=Japanese+Instrument+of+Surrender&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.archivesfoundation.org%2Fdocuments%2Fjapanese-instrument-surrender-1945%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-SanFrancisco1951-152"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-SanFrancisco1951_152-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://treaties.un.org/doc/Publication/UNTS/Volume%20136/volume-136-I-1832-English.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Treaty of Peace with Japan"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>United Nations Treaties Collection</i>. <li id="cite_note-Taipei1952-153"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Taipei1952_153-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://treaties.un.org/doc/Publication/UNTS/Volume%20138/v138.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Treaty of Peace between the Repuiblic of China and Japan"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>United Nations Treaties Collection</i>. The United Nations<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">29 November</span> 2021</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=United+Nations+Treaties+Collection&amp;rft.atitle=Treaty+of+Peace+between+the+Repuiblic+of+China+and+Japan&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Ftreaties.un.org%2Fdoc%2FPublication%2FUNTS%2FVolume%2520138%2Fv138.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEMakinenWoodward1989-154"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMakinenWoodward1989_154-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFMakinenWoodward1989">Makinen &amp; Woodward (1989)</a>: "Yet, the Chinese Nationalist government attempted to isolate Taiwan from the mainland inflation by creating it as an independent currency area. And during the later stages of the civil war it was able to end the hyperinflation on Taiwan, something it was unable to do on the mainland despite two attempts."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-155"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-155">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation magazine cs1">"Formosa in transition". <i>The World Today</i>. <li id="cite_note-1950-US-DoD-173"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1950-US-DoD_173-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFUS_Department_of_Defense1950">US Department of Defense (1950). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20060419074919/http://www.trumanlibrary.org/whistlestop/study_collections/korea/large/week1/kw_22_1.htm" rel="nofollow">"Classified Teletype Conference, dated 27 June 1950, between the Pentagon and General Douglas MacArthur regarding authorization to use naval and air forces in support of South Korea. Papers of Harry S. Truman: Naval Aide Files"</a>. Truman Presidential Library and Museum. p. 1 and 4. Archived from <a class="external text" href="https://www.trumanlibrary.org/whistlestop/study_collections/korea/large/week1/kw_22_1.htm" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 19 April 2006<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">9 March</span> 2006</span>. <q>Page 1: In addition 7th Fleet will take station so as to prevent invasion of Formosa and to insure that Formosa not be used as base of operations against Chinese mainland." Page 4: "Seventh Fleet is hereby assigned to operational control CINCFE for employment in following task hereby assigned CINCFE: By naval and air action prevent any attack on Formosa, or any air or sea offensive from Formosa against mainland of China.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Classified+Teletype+Conference%2C+dated+27+June+1950%2C+between+the+Pentagon+and+General+Douglas+MacArthur+regarding+authorization+to+use+naval+and+air+forces+in+support+of+South+Korea.+Papers+of+Harry+S.+Truman%3A+Naval+Aide+Files&amp;rft.pages=1+and+4&amp;rft.pub=Truman+Presidential+Library+and+Museum&amp;rft.date=1950&amp;rft.au=US+Department+of+Defense&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.trumanlibrary.org%2Fwhistlestop%2Fstudy_collections%2Fkorea%2Flarge%2Fweek1%2Fkw_22_1.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-175"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-175">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFAlagappa2001">Alagappa, Muthiah (2001). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=2Zx7nPeGWgwC&amp;pg=PA265" rel="nofollow"><i>Taiwan's presidential politics</i></a>.
