Sharpe. p. 265. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-7656-0834-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-7656-0834-5"><bdi>978-0-7656-0834-5</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Taiwan%27s+presidential+politics&amp;rft.pages=265&amp;rft.pub=M.E.+Sharpe&amp;rft.date=2001&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-7656-0834-5&amp;rft.aulast=Alagappa&amp;rft.aufirst=Muthiah&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D2Zx7nPeGWgwC%26pg%3DPA265&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-bbctimeline-coldwar-176"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-bbctimeline-coldwar_176-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/hi/english/static/in_depth/asia_pacific/2000/taiwan_elections2000/1955_1972.stm" rel="nofollow">"Taiwan Timeline – Cold war fortress"</a>. <i>BBC News</i>. 2002<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2 July</span> 2009</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=BBC+News&amp;rft.atitle=Taiwan+Timeline+%E2%80%93+Cold+war+fortress&amp;rft.date=2002&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2Fhi%2Fenglish%2Fstatic%2Fin_depth%2Fasia_pacific%2F2000%2Ftaiwan_elections2000%2F1955_1972.stm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEHsü1982173-177"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHsü1982173_177-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHsü1982173_177-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFHsü1982">Hsü (1982)</a>, p. 173.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEHsü1982174-178"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHsü1982174_178-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFHsü1982">Hsü (1982)</a>, p. 174.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-179"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-179">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20091220041321/http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,917286-3,00.html" rel="nofollow">"China: Chiang Kai-shek: Death of the Casualty"</a>. <i>Time</i>. 14 April 1975. p. 3. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,917286-3,00.html" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 20 December 2009<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">16 December</span> 2009</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Time&amp;rft.atitle=China%3A+Chiang+Kai-shek%3A+Death+of+the+Casualty&amp;rft.pages=3&amp;rft.date=1975-04-14&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.time.com%2Ftime%2Fmagazine%2Farticle%2F0%2C9171%2C917286-3%2C00.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEHsü1982175,_176-180"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHsü1982175,_176_180-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFHsü1982">Hsü (1982)</a>, p. 175, 176.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-181"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-181">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFSunJulie_Lee_WeiRamon_Hawley_MyersDonald_G._Gillin1994">Sun, Yat-sen; Julie Lee Wei; Ramon Hawley Myers; Donald G. Gillin (1994).  Julie Lee Wei; Ramon Hawley Myers; Donald G. Gillin (eds.). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=YA3TzmnYRpYC" rel="nofollow"><i>Prescriptions for saving China: selected writings of Sun Yat-sen</i></a>. Hoover Press. p. 36. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8179-9281-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8179-9281-1"><bdi>978-0-8179-9281-1</bdi></a>. <q>The party first applied Sun's concept of political tutelage by governing through martial law, not tolerating opposition parties, controlling the public media, and using the 1947 constitution drawn up on the China mainland to govern. Thus, much of the world in those years gave the government low scores for democracy and human rights but admitted it had accomplished an economic miracle.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Prescriptions+for+saving+China%3A+selected+writings+of+Sun+Yat-sen&amp;rft.pages=36&amp;rft.pub=Hoover+Press&amp;rft.date=1994&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-8179-9281-1&amp;rft.aulast=Sun&amp;rft.aufirst=Yat-sen&amp;rft.au=Julie+Lee+Wei&amp;rft.au=Ramon+Hawley+Myers&amp;rft.au=Donald+G.+Gillin&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DYA3TzmnYRpYC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-182"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-182">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFChaoRamon_Hawley_Myers1997">Chao, Linda; Ramon Hawley Myers (1997). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=tIiAd4MABAIC" rel="nofollow"><i>Democracy's new leaders in the Republic of China on Taiwan</i></a>. Hoover Press. p. 3. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8179-3802-4" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-8179-3802-4"><bdi>978-0-8179-3802-4</bdi></a>. <q>Although this party [the KMT] had initiated a democratic breakthrough and guided the democratic transition, it had also upheld martial law for thirty-six years and severely repressed political dissent and any efforts to establish an opposition party.<span class="nowrap"> </span>... How was it possible that this party, so hated by opposition politicians and long regarded by Western critics as a dictatorial, Leninist-type party, still remained in power?</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Democracy%27s+new+leaders+in+the+Republic+of+China+on+Taiwan&amp;rft.pages=3&amp;rft.pub=Hoover+Press&amp;rft.date=1997&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-8179-3802-4&amp;rft.aulast=Chao&amp;rft.aufirst=Linda&amp;rft.au=Ramon+Hawley+Myers&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DtIiAd4MABAIC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEFung200067-183"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEFung200067_183-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFFung2000">Fung (2000)</a>, p. 67: "Nanjing was not only undemocratic and repressive but also inefficient and corrupt.<span class="nowrap"> </span>... Furthermore, like other authoritarian regimes, the GMD sought to control people's mind."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEFung200085-184"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEFung200085_184-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFFung2000">Fung (2000)</a>, p. 85: "The response to national emergency, critics argued, was not merely military, it was, even more important, political, requiring the termination of one-party dictatorship and the development of democratic institutions."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-185"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-185">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFCopper2005">Copper, John Franklin (2005). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=761bWuEtEfEC" rel="nofollow"><i>Consolidating Taiwan's democracy</i></a>. University Press of America. p. 8. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-7618-2977-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-7618-2977-5"><bdi>978-0-7618-2977-5</bdi></a>. <q>Also, the "Temporary Provisions" (of the Constitution) did not permit forming new political parties, and those that existed at this time did not seriously compete with the Nationalist Party. Thus, at the national level the KMT did not permit competitive democratic elections.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Consolidating+Taiwan%27s+democracy&amp;rft.pages=8&amp;rft.pub=University+Press+of+America&amp;rft.date=2005&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-7618-2977-5&amp;rft.aulast=Copper&amp;rft.aufirst=John+Franklin&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D761bWuEtEfEC&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-194"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-194">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFPomfretMillerBlanchard2016">Pomfret, James; Miller, Matthew; Blanchard, Ben (17 January 2016). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190211044749/https://www.reuters.com/article/taiwan-election-idUSKCN0UV02I" rel="nofollow">"After vote, China tells Taiwan to abandon independence "hallucination"<span class="cs1-kern-right"></span>"</a>. <i>Reuters</i>. <li id="cite_note-TsaiDemocratizePRC-204"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-TsaiDemocratizePRC_204-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-01-05/china-must-democratize-for-taiwan-progress-president-tsai-says" rel="nofollow">"China Must Democratize for Taiwan Progress, President Tsai Says"</a>. 5 January 2019<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">6 January</span> 2019</span>. <q>Tsai called on Beijing to become more democratic and renounce the use of military force if it wants to have any chance of winning over the hearts and minds of the Taiwanese public.<span class="nowrap"> </span>... Chinese President Xi Jinping offered on Wednesday to begin discussions on unification with any parties or individuals that accept Taiwan is part of "one China." Both Tsai and the China-friendly opposition Kuomintang rejected Xi's proposal, saying his "one country, two systems" framework lacks support in Taiwan.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=China+Must+Democratize+for+Taiwan+Progress%2C+President+Tsai+Says&amp;rft.date=2019-01-05&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bloomberg.com%2Fnews%2Farticles%2F2019-01-05%2Fchina-must-democratize-for-taiwan-progress-president-tsai-says&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-indexreport2020-206"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-indexreport2020_206-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation report cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://pages.eiu.com/rs/753-RIQ-438/images/democracy-index-2020.pdf" rel="nofollow">Democracy Index 2020</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>The Economist Intelligence Unit</i> (Report). 2021. <q>The star-performer in this year's Democracy Index, measured by the change in both its score and rank, is Taiwan, which was upgraded from a 'flawed democracy' to a 'full democracy', after rising 20 places in the global ranking from 31st place to 11th</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=report&amp;rft.btitle=Democracy+Index+2020&amp;rft.date=2021&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fpages.eiu.com%2Frs%2F753-RIQ-438%2Fimages%2Fdemocracy-index-2020.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-FLII-Supplementary-208"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FLII-Supplementary_208-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFGranthamDuncanEvansJones2020">Grantham, H. <li id="cite_note-224"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-224">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://fas.org/nuke/guide/china/facility/liancheng.htm" rel="nofollow">"Liancheng / Lianfeng Airbase – Chinese Military Forces"</a>. Federation of American Scientists<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">7 June</span> 2009</span>. <q>In March 2000 it was reported that the PLA Air Force was deploying new air-defense missiles [possibly batteries of Russian-made S-300 missiles] opposite Taiwan at the coastal cities of Xiamen and Shantou, and at Longtian, near Fuzhou.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Liancheng+%2F+Lianfeng+Airbase+%E2%80%93+Chinese+Military+Forces&amp;rft.pub=Federation+of+American+Scientists&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Ffas.org%2Fnuke%2Fguide%2Fchina%2Ffacility%2Fliancheng.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-2004NatDefRpt-225"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2004NatDefRpt_225-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://china.usc.edu/sites/default/files/article/attachments/taiwan-2004-national-defense-report.pdf" rel="nofollow">"2004 National Defense Report"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>ROC Ministry of National Defense</i>. 2004<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-TRA-review-258"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-TRA-review_258-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-TRA-review_258-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFYates1999"><a href="/wiki/Stephen_J._Yates" title="Stephen J. Yates">Yates, Stephen J.</a> (16 April 1999). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090722095740/http://www.heritage.org/research/asiaandthepacific/bg1272.cfm" rel="nofollow">"The Taiwan Relations Act After 20 Years: Keys to Past and Future Success"</a>. The Heritage Foundation. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.heritage.org/research/asiaandthepacific/bg1272.cfm" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 22 July 2009<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">19 July</span> 2009</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+Taiwan+Relations+Act+After+20+Years%3A+Keys+to+Past+and+Future+Success&amp;rft.pub=The+Heritage+Foundation&amp;rft.date=1999-04-16&amp;rft.aulast=Yates&amp;rft.aufirst=Stephen+J.&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.heritage.org%2Fresearch%2Fasiaandthepacific%2Fbg1272.cfm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-Brownell2007-277"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Brownell2007_277-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external free" href="http://hnn.us/article/51398#sthash.04ZCBpL4.dpuf" rel="nofollow">http://hnn.us/article/51398#sthash.04ZCBpL4.dpuf</a>; George Mason University History News Network: Susan Brownell, "Could China stop Taiwan from coming to the Olympic Games?"; original source: Minutes of the Executive Board meeting, Nagoya, Japan, 23–25 October 1979, p. 103; viewed 26 August 2014.</span>

<li id="cite_note-284"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-284">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFEnav2008">Enav, Peter (16 May 2008). <a class="external text" href="http://www.chinapost.com.tw/taiwan/national/national%20news/2008/05/16/156644/Unification-with.htm" rel="nofollow">"Unification with China unlikely 'in our lifetimes': president-elect"</a>. <i>China Post</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">13 June</span> 2009</span>. <q>'It is very difficult for us to see any unification talks even in our lifetimes,' Ma said. 'Taiwanese people would like to have economic interactions with the mainland, but obviously they don't believe their political system is suitable for Taiwan.'</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=China+Post&amp;rft.atitle=Unification+with+China+unlikely+%27in+our+lifetimes%27%3A+president-elect&amp;rft.date=2008-05-16&amp;rft.aulast=Enav&amp;rft.aufirst=Peter&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.chinapost.com.tw%2Ftaiwan%2Fnational%2Fnational%2520news%2F2008%2F05%2F16%2F156644%2FUnification-with.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-285"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-285">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/shared/spl/hi/asia_pac/04/taiwan_flashpoint/html/independence_debate.stm" rel="nofollow">"Taiwan Flashpoint: Independence debate"</a>. <i>BBC News</i>. 2009. <q>Since neither outcome looks likely in the short or even medium term, it is perhaps not surprising that opinion polls suggest most Taiwanese people want things to stay as they are, with the island's ambiguous status unresolved.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=BBC+News&amp;rft.atitle=Taiwan+Flashpoint%3A+Independence+debate&amp;rft.date=2009&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F1%2Fshared%2Fspl%2Fhi%2Fasia_pac%2F04%2Ftaiwan_flashpoint%2Fhtml%2Findependence_debate.stm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-286"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-286">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="http://www.oem.com.mx/oem/notas/n836891.htm" rel="nofollow">"Impulsa Taiwan la reconciliación"</a>. <i>El Sol de México</i> (in Spanish). 2 September 2008<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">9 June</span> 2009</span>. <q>Esencialmente, no definiríamos la relación a través del estrecho de Taiwan como una relación de dos países o dos Chinas, porque nuestra Constitución no lo permite. Nosotros definiríamos está relación como una relación muy especial, ya que la Constitución nuestra, igual que la Constitución de China continental, no permite la existencia de otro país dentro del territorio.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=El+Sol+de+M%C3%A9xico&amp;rft.atitle=Impulsa+Taiwan+la+reconciliaci%C3%B3n&amp;rft.date=2008-09-02&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.oem.com.mx%2Foem%2Fnotas%2Fn836891.htm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-yb:government-290"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-yb:government_290-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-yb:government_290-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-yb:government_290-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-yb:government_290-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-yb:government_290-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-yb:government_290-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-yb:government_290-6"><sup><i><b>g</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20080512091917/http://www.gio.gov.tw/taiwan-website/5-gp/yearbook/" rel="nofollow">"Chapter 4: Government"</a>. <a class="external text" href="http://www.gio.gov.tw/taiwan-website/5-gp/yearbook/" rel="nofollow"><i>The Republic of China Yearbook</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-292"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-292">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFHuang2006">Huang, Jei-hsuan (14 September 2006). <a class="external text" href="http://www.taipeitimes.com/News/editorials/archives/2006/09/14/2003327608" rel="nofollow">"Letter: KMT holds the key"</a>. <i>Taipei Times</i>. p. 8<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite_note-293"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-293">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFJayasuriya1999">Jayasuriya, Kanishka (1999). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=OqGSrD9QhXcC&amp;pg=PA217" rel="nofollow"><i>Law, capitalism and power in Asia</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-panblue-reunif-chineseid-312"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-panblue-reunif-chineseid_312-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-panblue-reunif-chineseid_312-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFPares2005">Pares, Susan (24 February 2005). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=xJKePP5ATKUC" rel="nofollow"><i>A political and economic dictionary of East Asia</i></a>. <li id="cite_note-320"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-320">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFOkazaki2008">Okazaki, Hisahiko (30 December 2008). <a class="external text" href="http://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/eo20081230ho.html" rel="nofollow">"No sign of a 'peace agreement'<span class="cs1-kern-right"></span>"</a>. <i>Japan Times</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">15 July</span> 2009</span>. <q>For one thing, I believe there is recognition that the awareness of Taiwanese identity is now irreversible. The KMT government did things like rename the "Taiwan Post" to "Chunghwa Post" as soon as it came in. But it did not take much time to perceive that it would cause a backlash among the Taiwan populace. The cross-strait exchanges have also brought about opposition demonstrations from time to time. This appears to be one of the reasons for the abrupt decline in the approval rating of the Ma administration.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Japan+Times&amp;rft.atitle=No+sign+of+a+%27peace+agreement%27&amp;rft.date=2008-12-30&amp;rft.aulast=Okazaki&amp;rft.aufirst=Hisahiko&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fsearch.japantimes.co.jp%2Fcgi-bin%2Feo20081230ho.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-321"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-321">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20071024135148/http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1211639,00.html" rel="nofollow">"10 Questions: Ma Ying-jeou"</a>. <i>Time</i>. 10 July 2006. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1211639,00.html" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 24 October 2007<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-324"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-324">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190129130923/http://www.tpg.gov.tw/" rel="nofollow">"Taiwan Provincial Government Official Website"</a>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">21 October</span> 2018</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Taiwan+Provincial+Government+Official+Website&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.tpg.gov.tw%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-325"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-325">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation cs2"><a class="external text" href="http://www.taipeitimes.com/News/archives/2002/10/11/0000175237" rel="nofollow">"Mongolian office to ride into Taipei by end of the year"</a>, <i>Taipei Times</i>, 11 October 2002, <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090210192036/http://www.taipeitimes.com/News/archives/2002/10/11/0000175237" rel="nofollow">archived</a> from the original on 10 February 2009<span class="reference-accessdate">, retrieved <span class="nowrap">5 February</span> 2008</span></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Taipei+Times&amp;rft.atitle=Mongolian+office+to+ride+into+Taipei+by+end+of+the+year&amp;rft.date=2002-10-11&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.taipeitimes.com%2FNews%2Farchives%2F2002%2F10%2F11%2F0000175237&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-326"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-326">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090210192036/http://www.taipeitimes.com/News/archives/2002/10/11/0000175237" rel="nofollow">"Mongolian office to ride into Taipei by end of the year"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Taipei_Times" title="Taipei Times">Taipei Times</a></i>. 11 October 2002. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.taipeitimes.com/News/archives/2002/10/11/0000175237" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 10 February 2009<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">28 May</span> 2009</span>. <q>In October 1945, the people of Outer Mongolia voted for independence, gaining the recognition of many countries, including the Republic of China. (...) Due to a souring of relations with the Soviet Union in the early 1950s, however, the ROC revoked recognition of Outer Mongolia, reclaiming it as ROC territory. {...} Long a province of China, Mongolia declared its independence in 1921 with Soviet backing. After the Ministry of the Interior's recent decision to exclude Mongolia from the official ROC map, on 3 Oct, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced that Taiwan recognizes Mongolia as an independent country -- 81 years after Mongolia declared its independence.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Taipei+Times&amp;rft.atitle=Mongolian+office+to+ride+into+Taipei+by+end+of+the+year&amp;rft.date=2002-10-11&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.taipeitimes.com%2FNews%2Farchives%2F2002%2F10%2F11%2F0000175237&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-327"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-327">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/asia-pacific/279170.stm" rel="nofollow">"World: Asia-Pacific Analysis: Flashpoint Spratly"</a>. BBC. 14 February 1999.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=World%3A+Asia-Pacific+Analysis%3A+Flashpoint+Spratly&amp;rft.date=1999-02-14&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.bbc.co.uk%2F2%2Fhi%2Fasia-pacific%2F279170.stm&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-354"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-354">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFCabestan2001">Cabestan, Jean-Pierre (2001). <a class="external text" href="http://www.ceri-sciencespo.com/archive/july01/jpcabest.pdf" rel="nofollow">"France's Taiwan Policy: A Case of Shopkeeper Diplomacy"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. CERI<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">5 June</span> 2009</span>. <q>By excluding the French companies from the bidding lists of many contract, Peking wanted above all to stop a growing trend<span class="nowrap"> </span>... to disregard its objections and interests in the Taiwan issue.<span class="nowrap"> </span>... In spite of the ban of arms sales to Taiwan approved by the French government in January 1994, discreet and small-sized deals have continued to be concluded since then.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=France%27s+Taiwan+Policy%3A+A+Case+of+Shopkeeper+Diplomacy&amp;rft.pub=CERI&amp;rft.date=2001&amp;rft.aulast=Cabestan&amp;rft.aufirst=Jean-Pierre&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ceri-sciencespo.com%2Farchive%2Fjuly01%2Fjpcabest.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-357"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-357">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFKapsteinMichael_Mastanduno1999">Kapstein, Ethan B.; Michael Mastanduno (1999). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=68s2k0ztkCMC&amp;pg=PA194" rel="nofollow"><i>Unipolar politics</i></a>. Columbia University Press. p. 194. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-231-11309-0" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-231-11309-0"><bdi>978-0-231-11309-0</bdi></a>. <q>The Japanese leadership openly split on whether a crisis in Taiwan was included in the geographic expression "area surrounding Japan." In the event, Japan refused to stipulate the contingencies under which it would provide rear area support for U.S. forces or even the geographic scope of the "area surrounding Japan".<span class="nowrap"> </span>... The two sides have not articulated clearly what the alliance stands <i>for</i>, nor who it is defined to protect <i>against</i>.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Unipolar+politics&amp;rft.pages=194&amp;rft.pub=Columbia+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1999&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-231-11309-0&amp;rft.aulast=Kapstein&amp;rft.aufirst=Ethan+B.&amp;rft.au=Michael+Mastanduno&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3D68s2k0ztkCMC%26pg%3DPA194&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-sei21-359"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-sei21_359-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFSeidel2021">Seidel, Jamie (31 October 2021). <a class="external text" href="https://www.news.com.au/technology/innovation/military/china-reacts-to-peter-duttons-jawdropping-promise-to-defend-taiwan/news-story/3644a042edd36c1b141a38017acf61e3" rel="nofollow">"China reacts to Peter Duttons 'jaw-dropping' promise to defend Taiwan"</a>. <i>news.com.au</i>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">13 November</span> 2021</span>. <q>The Republic of China autocracy-turned-democracy didn't surrender to the Communist Party uprising during the 1949 civil war. It has no intention of doing so now. Now Taipei's own defence minister, Chiu Kuo-cheng, says his country is prepared to defend itself alone, if necessary. "The country must rely on itself," he told media Thursday. "If any friends or other groups can help us, then we're happy to have it. But we cannot completely depend on it."</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=news.com.au&amp;rft.atitle=China+reacts+to+Peter+Duttons+%27jaw-dropping%27+promise+to+defend+Taiwan&amp;rft.date=2021-10-31&amp;rft.aulast=Seidel&amp;rft.aufirst=Jamie&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.news.com.au%2Ftechnology%2Finnovation%2Fmilitary%2Fchina-reacts-to-peter-duttons-jawdropping-promise-to-defend-taiwan%2Fnews-story%2F3644a042edd36c1b141a38017acf61e3&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-368"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-368">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/speeches-remarks/2022/05/23/remarks-by-president-biden-and-prime-minister-fumio-kishida-of-japan-in-joint-press-conference/" rel="nofollow">"Remarks by President Biden and Prime Minister Kishida Fumio of Japan in Joint Press Conference"</a>. <i>The White House</i>. 23 May 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-374"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-374">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFMakinenWoodward1989">Makinen &amp; Woodward 1989</a>: "It was the fiscal regime change on Taiwan, as in the European episodes, that finally brought price stability. It was the aid policy that brought the budget to near balance, and when the aid programme reached its full proportions in 1952, prices stabilized."</span>

<li id="cite_note-381"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-381">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFDoIT2008">DoIT 2008</a>, p. 5 "Although used-to-be-hostile tension between Taiwan and China has been eased to a certain degree, Taiwan should seek to maintain stable relation with China while continuing to protect national security, and avoiding excessive "Sinicization" of Taiwanese economy. Strategies to avoid excessive "Sinicization" of the Taiwanese economy could include efforts to increase geographic diversity of overseas Taiwanese employment, diversifying Taiwan's export markets and investment. "</span>

<li id="cite_note-386"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-386">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20090608110113/http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qa5411/is_199801/ai_n21432097/" rel="nofollow">"Coping with Asian financial crisis: The Taiwan experience | Seoul Journal of Economics"</a>. <li id="cite_note-441"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-441">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFCheong2001">Cheong, Ching (2001). <i>Will Taiwan break away: the rise of Taiwanese nationalism</i>. World Scientific. p. 187. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-981-02-4486-6" title="Special:BookSources/978-981-02-4486-6"><bdi>978-981-02-4486-6</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Will+Taiwan+break+away%3A+the+rise+of+Taiwanese+nationalism&amp;rft.pages=187&amp;rft.pub=World+Scientific&amp;rft.date=2001&amp;rft.isbn=978-981-02-4486-6&amp;rft.aulast=Cheong&amp;rft.aufirst=Ching&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ATaiwan"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-452"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-452">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&amp;id=1ChqeM59-jyB5wE2_72d8XKcTmgyq3MOB" rel="nofollow">"THE FREEDOM OF THOUGHT REPORT 2018"</a>. 2018. p. 14<span class="reference-accessdate">. <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Overviews_and_data">Overviews and data</span></h3>
<ul><li><a class="external text" href="https://www.cia.gov/the-world-factbook/countries/taiwan/" rel="nofollow">Taiwan</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_World_Factbook" title="The World Factbook">The World Factbook</a></i>. <a href="/wiki/Central_Intelligence_Agency" title="Central Intelligence Agency">Central Intelligence Agency</a>.</li>

title="Category:Articles with NDL identifiers">Articles with NDL identifiers</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Category:Articles_with_NLA_identifiers" title="Category:Articles with NLA identifiers">Articles with NLA identifiers</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Category:Articles_with_NLK_identifiers" title="Category:Articles with NLK identifiers">Articles with NLK identifiers</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Category:Articles_with_VcBA_identifiers" title="Category:Articles with VcBA identifiers">Articles with VcBA identifiers</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Category:Articles_with_HDS_identifiers"
